snippet: A crucial question for Republicans is how heavily they can press their cases against President Obama without provoking a backlash.
abstract: Investigations ensnaring White House have unified Republican Party, energized a political base shattered by election losses and given common purpose to lawmakers divided over legislative agenda; most pressing question for Congressional Republicans is no longer how to finesse changes to immigration law or gun control, but how far they can push their cases against Pres Obama without inciting backlash of sort that has left them staggering in the past.
lead_paragraph: A crucial question for Republicans is how heavily they can press their cases against President Obama without provoking a backlash.

headline.seo: Energized G.O.P. Weighs How Far to Go in Inquiries
headline.main: G.O.P., Energized, Weighs How Far to Take Inquiries
headline.print_headline: G.O.P., Energized, Weighs How Far To Take Inquiries
